label: Behavior 79856679
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the vessel progresses northeastward along a gently curving path, likely aligned with a designated traffic lane or coastal navigation route; the trajectory can be approximated by a circular arc: $ \text{lat} = a + R \cos(\theta), \text{lon} = b + R \sin(\theta) $, where $ R $ is radius of curvature derived from average turn rate and SOG)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a consistent speed between 7.0 and 9.9 knots with minor fluctuations, indicating steady propulsion)
Course change: gradual and consistent (the COG varies slowly between 22.7° and 32.9°, showing a smooth directional transition over time)
Heading fluctuation: stable (the heading remains within a narrow range of 35°–38°, suggesting minimal rudder activity and stable steering)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the vessel progresses northeastward along a gently curving path, likely aligned with a designated traffic lane or coastal navigation route; the trajectory can be approximated by a circular arc: $ \text{lat} = a + R \cos(\theta), \text{lon} = b + R \sin(\theta) $, where $ R $ is radius of curvature derived from average turn rate and SOG)
